page.title: 19COD BECK RESERVOIR
page.content: Cod Beck reservoir G.R.467990 lies in one of the glacial overflow channels of the North York Moors to the north of Osmotherley.Work began on the reservoir in 1948 and was completed in 1953.Before that date Osmotherley's water supply came from springs on Ruebury hill and was piped to taps in the village.The reservoir was built by the Northallerton and District Water Board as the supply from the Oakdale reservoirs was insufficient to meet the demand of Northallerton and surrounding district. The water is treated at the filter station in Osmotherley.Water is pumped to the reservoirs in Osmotherley and put into supply by gravity.It is also sent to the reservoirs of Northallerton. Cod Beck covers an area of 24 acres and has a capacity of 115 million gallons, average daily output of 924,000 galls.
